metadata.title: CVE-2024-42132 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:bluetooth/hci: disallow setting handle bigger than HCI_CONN_HANDLE_MAXSyzbot hit warning in hci_conn_del() caused by freeing handle that wasnot allocated using ida allocator.This is caused by handle bigger than HCI_CONN_HANDLE_MAX passed byhci_le_big_sync_established_evt(), which makes code think it's unsetconnection.Add same check for handle upper bound as in hci_conn_set_handle() toprevent warning.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
